Articles.Content:
So I sent a ship to jool with some probes, realized all the probes were clipped into the decouplers and exploded on decoupling.

New ship, decouplers work fine. My space probe is a slightly modified stock probe, which apparently generates 2 energy per second and requires 13 to run the engine. Which I figure out while orbiting jool.

I get it, need more testing at home. So here's the third iteration with giant solar arrays, which apparently are blocking themselves?

Anyone know what's going on?

Edited June 19, 2013 by ScottyDoesKnow
The sunlight looks like it's coming in parallel to the solar array's axis.
Ahhhhh the light is blocked! I thought it was saying it was physically blocked from rotating or something. Thanks!

Just a blib in my head but - did anyone ever check if the motors that rotate solar panels were in any way responsible for the wobble of destruction?

Even with no SAS on board my station starts to shudder and whirl ...
